hook.text: Everything you see in a photograph is made of light. Without it, cameras are useless boxes.

buildup.text: Light is electromagnetic radiation our eyes can detect. It travels in waves at 300,000 km per second.

discovery.text: Cameras capture light reflected off objects. The color, intensity, and angle of light define every image.

twist.text: We don't photograph objects â€” we photograph the light bouncing off them. No object, no light, no photo.

climax.text: Understanding light is the single most important skill in photography. Everything else is secondary.

quiz.question: What does a camera actually capture?
